Israel prepares to occupy the entire Gaza Strip
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has announced his intention to draw Israel into a full-scale occupation war, a plan examined by the security cabinet during a meeting on Thursday. The operation would target the remaining quarter of the territory, starting with Gaza City.

headline: International backlash grows over Israel's Gaza City offensive plans
French firefighters optimistic after controlling vast wildfire in the south
Direct mayoral elections in Paris, Lyon, Marseille get green light from France's top court
description: The voting system in France's three largest cities will change in 2026, allowing voters to cast their ballots directly for central city councilors. The change could benefit right-wing mayoral hopeful Rachida Dati.

headline: Trumpism: A political phenomenon that defies all definition
description: Techno-libertarian, isolationist fascist, plutocratic populist? The politics of the 47th US president are impossible to pin down. While some compare his approach to certain European regimes, others argue it should be understood strictly within an American context – even if that means inventing a new term.

headline: On an Indonesian island, traces of human presence over one million years old have been discovered
description: Seven stone tools found on the island of Sulawesi are challenging current knowledge about the colonization of Asia by the genus 'Homo.' This landmass could only have been populated after a sea crossing, whether intentional or accidental. Many mysteries remain.

headline: France's Constitutional Council partially blocks Duplomb Law, yet political battles continue
description: The right to live in a healthy environment, a core principle of the French Environmental Charter, was invoked by the Constitutional Council to strike down the law's most emblematic article on neonicotinoids. This decision is a blow to the government, which has struggled to resolve the ongoing agricultural crisis.

How Lake Chad became neglected by international aid
description: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (3/4). After a surge of solidarity in response to the attacks by Boko Haram, global attention has shifted away from the region. As NGOs have been weakened by the halt in US funding, the humanitarian situation remains dire.

headline: In rural France, young people keep the local tradition of partying alive
description: 'Why Do We Party?' (1/6). In eastern Rignieu-le-Désert, the Amicale Des Jeunes youth association upholds the tradition of local balls, a custom that in some places is now seen as a way of preserving local identity.

headline: Wildfires blaze in southern France: 'It looked like the apocalypse'
description: In the Corbières hills, 16,000 hectares went up in flames in just 24 hours, despite 2,500 firefighters and the mobilization of nearly all of France's aerial resources.
